intro: Astragalus intarrensis f. subintarrensis, commonly known as the subintarrensi form, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh climatic conditions. Its subspecies is distinguished by subtle morphological differences from the main species, including variations in leaf structure and flower size. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
